00020 /*
00021  * ---------------------------------------------------------------
00022  * Definitions:
00023  */
00024 // The interface to the LSODE solver.
00025 //
00026 // The parameters are:
00027 //
00028 //         f: The field's function
00029 //       neq: The number of equations
00030 //         y: The point where the solution is to be computed --  entrada !!
00031 //         t: The time at which the solution will begin to be computed  -- para ODESolution
00032 //      tout: The time at which the solution stops being computed -- para ODESolution
00033 //      itol: 1 (scalar) or 2 (array), see atol (below)
00034 //      rtol: Relative tolerance parameter (scalar)
00035 //      atol: Absolute tolerance parameter (scalar or array), see itol
00036 //     itask: 1 for normal computation of of output values of y at t = tout
00037 //    istate: Integer flag. Set istate = 1.
00038 //      iopt: 0 to indicate no optional inputs are used
00039 //     rwork: Array of reals, of length at least:
00040 //       lrw= 20 + 16*neq                      for mf = 10,
00041 //            22 +  9*neq + neq**2             for mf = 21 or 22,
00042 //            22 + 10*neq + (2*ml + mu)*neq    for mf = 24 or 25.
00043 //       lrw: Declared length of rwork
00044 //     iwork: Array of integers of length at least:
00045 //      liw=  20                               for mf = 10,
00046 //            20 + neq                         for mf = 21, 22, 24 or 25.
00047 //            If mf = 24 or 25, iwork(0) = ml and iwork(1) = mu.
00048 //       liw: Declared length of iwork
00049 //         j: The field's Jacobian, for mf = 24 or 25. Otherwise, pass
00050 //            a dummy function.
00051 //        mf: Method flag:
00052 //            10: Nonstiff (Adams) method, no Jacobian used.
00053 //            21: Stiff (BDF) method, user-supplied full Jacobian.
00054 //            22: Stiff method, internally generated full Jacobian.
00055 //            24: Stiff method, user-supplied banded Jacobian.
00056 //            25: Stiff method, internally generated banded Jacobian.
00057 //
00058 // The output is stored at:
00059 //         y: Thus, y is a vector for input/output.
00060 //         t: Normally should be tout.
00061 //    istate: Takes one of the following at output:  -- para ODESolution
00062 //             2: Successful,
00063 //            -1: Excessive work performed at this call, perhaps mf is wrong,
00064 //            -2: Excessive accuracy requested (tolerance is too small),
00065 //            -3: Illegal input detected (see printed output),
00066 //            -4: Repeated error tests failures (check all input values),
00067 //            -5: Repeated convergence failures (check Jacobian and mf),
00068 //            -6: Error weight became zero, atol or atol(i) vanished.
00069 //
00070 //            -7: f or jac returned with an error. This was added by R. Morante
00071 //                to the lsode solver in Fortran.
00072 
00073 class LSODEProfile:public ODESolverProfile {
00074     
00075 private:
00076     
00077     
00078 //         f: The field's function
00079 //         j: The field's Jacobian, for mf = 24 or 25. Otherwise, pass
00080 //         a dummy function.
00081     
00082     double * atol_;
00083     double *  rwork_;
00084     double *  param_;
00085     
00086     int * iwork_;
00087     
00088     double deltaxi_;
00089     double rtol_;
00090     
00091     int  neq_;
00092     int itol_;
00093     int itask_;
00094     
00095     int  iopt_;
00096     int   lrw_;
00097     int   liw_;
00098     int    mf_;
00099     int paramLength_;
00100     
00101 public:
00102 //              neq  ,  itol, rtol, itask,istate, iopt , rwork , lrw ,iwork, liw , mf,
00103     LSODEProfile(const RpFunction &, const LSODEStopGenerator &, int ,  int , double, int , double , int , const double * );
00104     LSODEProfile(const LSODEProfile &);
00105     
00106     virtual ~LSODEProfile();
00107     
00108     LSODEProfile & operator=(const LSODEProfile &);
00109     
00110     int numberOfEquations() const ;
00111     
00112     int absoluteToleranceType() const ;
00113     int lengthRWork() const ;
00114     int lengthIWork() const ;
00115     int task() const ;
00116     
00117     int opt()const ;
00118     int methodFlag()const  ;
00119     double relativeTolerance() const ;
00120     int paramLength() const;
00121     double absoluteToleranceComponent(const int) const ;
00122     double deltaTime()const ;
00123     
00124     
00125     int  iworkComponent(const int )const;
00126     double  rworkComponent(const int)const  ;
00127     
00128     double paramComponent(const int) const ;
00129     
00130 };

00136 inline int LSODEProfile::task()const{return itask_;}

00151 inline double  LSODEProfile::paramComponent(const int index) const {
00152     
00153     if (index < 0 || index > paramLength_){
00154         
00155         cout << "Erro in param length! "<< endl;
00156         return 0;
00157     }
00158     
00159     return param_[index];
00160 }
00161 inline int LSODEProfile::absoluteToleranceType() const {return itol_;}
00162 inline int LSODEProfile::numberOfEquations()const{return neq_;}
00163 
00164 inline double LSODEProfile::absoluteToleranceComponent(const int index)const{
00165     
00166     if (index <0 || index > neq_) {
00167         
00168         cout << "Error in absolute tolerance index" << endl;
00169         return 0;
00170     }
00171     
00172     return atol_[index];
00173 }
